TopicTitle: ALT+F12 debug menu not working anymore

Articles.Content:
What the subject says. I haven't played in a while and I found out I couldn't.

Did they remove the feature?
It works fine for me. Are you on a laptop? Maybe try Alt-FN-F12?

5 hours ago, FullMetalMachinist said:

It works fine for me. Are you on a laptop? Maybe try Alt-FN-F12? 

Nope, desktop. It doesn't do anything. The key works fine otherwise, it's jhus tthe debug menu won't pop up.
The keyboard doesn't have some kind of 'FN lock' button?

12 hours ago, Sonny_Jim said:

The keyboard doesn't have some kind of 'FN lock' button?  

I've been using the function keys in laptops and non-laptops for decades. I know how to press F12 , and when to press Fn modifier in laptops ty. And no it's not working.

I understand that this is a frustrating issue for you, but I'm not trying to sound condescending.   I'm just making sure that all the bases are covered.  I've had desktop keyboards default to non-function keys on boot so was just making sure it was something you had checked.

Does the F12 key work if you go to this website?

http://www.keyboardtester.com/

On 2/9/2016 at 3:34 PM, Sonny_Jim said:

I understand that this is a frustrating issue for you, but I'm not trying to sound condescending.   I'm just making sure that all the bases are covered.  I've had desktop keyboards default to non-function keys on boot so was just making sure it was something you had checked.

Does the F12 key work if you go to this website?

http://www.keyboardtester.com/

Yes all keys work perfectly accoridng the useful link you pasted, again I use the F keys for a lot more than KSP I would have been able to know. I tried also all the alts and control, shifts etc.

Edited September 5, 2016 by jebodiah1976
It's working for me.  Maybe there's a mod that has its hotkey assigned to Alt-F12.  Or is there a key assignment in the settings that got changed?

It might be worth testing it on a completely un-modded install.  If it still does it on that then I would file a bug report.

Have you changed any of the key configuration?  Like added a joystick or whatever?
Are you on Linux by chance? On that platform it's RShift-F12 rather than Alt-F12.

Anyway, I'm on windows, this is a desktop, therefore it doesn't have a "Fn" key , the alt key is the right modifier in the game since ALT+F2 (opening debug) works, and googling about this I am not the only one that has this problem.

Can anyone think of a solution?

---POST EDIT

 

Ok for the record and I leave this , so it's noted in case someone else has this problem and googles this in the future,  I found the solution. GeForce Shadowplay experience (which is isntalled btw in like the vast majority of every gamer nowadays) uses that key to toggle fps on and off by default. Setting it up to something else on geforce experience solves this problem.

Edited September 24, 2016 by jebodiah1976
I foudn the solution myself
I had the same issue. CTRL+ALT+F12 made it work for me (Using Windows 10 x64 desktop).

On 9/24/2016 at 12:25 PM, jebodiah1976 said:

Anyway, I'm on windows, this is a desktop, therefore it doesn't have a "Fn" key , the alt key is the right modifier in the game since ALT+F2 (opening debug) works, and googling about this I am not the only one that has this problem.

Can anyone think of a solution?

---POST EDIT

 

Ok for the record and I leave this , so it's noted in case someone else has this problem and googles this in the future,  I found the solution. GeForce Shadowplay experience (which is isntalled btw in like the vast majority of every gamer nowadays) uses that key to toggle fps on and off by default. Setting it up to something else on geforce experience solves this problem.

I joined to share that this solution solved my alt+F12 issue. Thank you

Well since the other guy revived this I'll report also that this was my problem. It was the Geforce overlay thing. Errr Nvidia!

Edited February 14, 2019 by SpaceFoon
Had similar issue running on Windows, was able to fix by switching my keyboard from mac OS mode, to Windows mode.
